Each scale has specific functionality in terms of the planning processes. Firesheds are the broad scale unit of prioritization, but planning areas within them are also prioritized as part of implementation of treatments. Planning areas are roughly the size that national forests use for conducting vegetation and fuel management projects. The relative variation among firesheds compared to variation within them controls the relative emphasis on selecting firesheds versus individual planning areas.
